stream_context.summary: Kaze livestreamed engine and gameplay programming for Return to Yoshi’s Island. He polished an overworld door unlock sequence, experimented with star-unlock particle effects, drafted a storybook intro cut-scene, and began coding a pay-to-use cannon NPC while showing a freshly finished level on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: Engine source will remain private during development but be made open-source when the game is finished.
development_findings.quote: This right now is not open source yet. It will be open source though, once it's done.

development_findings.summary: An overworld door now requires a star unlock animation that spawns multiple stars, scales them via a smooth-step curve, showers Mario in pixie-dust particles, and varies star count by required stars.
Custom ‘tick’ behavior command replaces original Mario 64 script loop, saving ~2 µs per actor (~200 µs for 100 actors) by avoiding extra cache misses.
development_findings.quote: That's like 200 microseconds you just throw away.

development_findings.summary: Planned major optimization: replace all 4×4 matrices with 4×3 to cut memory and CPU, described as "a pretty big optimization" still pending.

Storyboard intro will transition from 3D scenes to 2D storybook pages (CI8 320×240 images, ~0.5 MB uncompressed) that fade back to 3D island before gameplay. Kaze is considering streaming or separate level to keep memory under 4–7 MB budget.
development_findings.quote: ...storybook first, but it fades out to reveal the 3D island. Camera pans to Mario.

development_findings.summary: Memory budgeting shows ~4 MB free ROM space; further compression by Redz could free ~4 MB more. RAM is deemed non-issue.
Implemented widescreen, anti-aliasing, and high-cost graphics options on real N64 hardware; still maintains 30 FPS in new level.
Created ‘Corrupt Dom’ Bob-omb NPC who patrols and charges 200 coins to unlock cannon; dialogue system refactor broke yes/no choice handling, so feature is blocked until dialogue fix.
Future tasks flagged: apply water surface around island, build larger particle system with ribbons, finish sand form transformation, and convert cannon area geometry.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s motivation philosophy: work should not depend on feeling motivated; "just work".
context_findings.quote: If you need motivation, you're already fucked up. Just work.

context_findings.summary: He emigrated from Germany to Canada, citing "Germany sucks" and easier migration for programmers.
Expressed frustration at Microsoft PowerPoint and minor stream tech hiccups, but excitement over visual breakthroughs (storybook, star effect).
Reiterated view that game worlds are narrative abstractions, not literal 1-to-1 spaces.
context_findings.quote: You need to think about games more as a story that you're being told... they're not gonna give you every unnecessary detail.

biobak.summary: Provided storyboard art for Yoshi memory flashback; actively shares assets via Discord.

badub.summary: Composer expected to supply music that evolves as more Yoshis are rescued and to score storybook cut-scene.
badub.quote: Oh yeah, I'm sure Badub can pull that up.

zeina.summary: Brief appearance in chat; no project contribution mentioned this session.

key_stories.title: Designing the Storybook Intro
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstorms an opening sequence that shifts from 3D to hand-drawn storybook panels and back, balancing artistic vision with N64 memory limits.
key_stories.challenge: Blend narrative flair with hardware constraints.
key_stories.process: Sketched sequence beats live, calculated image memory (0.5 MB), discussed CI8 compression and streaming options, and noted need for Biobak art and Badub music.
key_stories.outcome: Concept accepted as "so fucking cool"; written into task notes for future implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine this is a 3D scene ... it turns into a storybook ... then the storybook overlay disappears to reveal the island in 3D.

key_stories.title: Reinventing Star Unlocks
key_stories.summary: Default Mario 64 star cut-scene is replaced by dynamic, multi-star particle spectacle.
key_stories.challenge: Create a fresh, satisfying unlock animation fitting Yoshi’s Island theme.
key_stories.process: Programmed smooth-step scaling, adjustable star count, and pixie-dust particles; iterated on timing, scaling, and dust size live.
key_stories.outcome: Visual finalized for now; will extend to all stars once explosion particles added.
key_stories.key_quote: All stars should do this instead, right? That looks so much better than a normal star animation.

key_stories.title: The Corrupt Cannon Keeper
key_stories.summary: An NPC demands coins to grant cannon access, adding an economy layer to progression.
key_stories.challenge: Introduce monetary gating with believable character behavior.
key_stories.process: Moved geometry, coded patrol AI, set dialogue states, but refactor broke yes/no prompts.
key_stories.outcome: Feature partially functional; dialogue system to be fixed off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I want this to cost coins ... a guy that's like, 'I'll let you use my cannon, but I want 200 coins from you.'

open_questions.context: Kaze acknowledged he doesn’t fully grasp WaveRace 64’s water model but intends to implement similar visuals/physics.
questions: What specific physical behaviors are you aiming to replicate?
Have you prototyped any part of the water yet?
Which team member will support shaders/textures for it?

open_questions.context: Yes/No choice always returns zero after recent overhaul, blocking Corrupt Dom and any NPC interactions.
questions: What changes were introduced in the refactor?
How will you test and safeguard future dialogue changes?
Does anyone else review core engine commits?

open_questions.context: Kaze teased an upcoming ‘sand form’ mechanic as "very fun" but gave no details.
questions: What gameplay purpose will sand form serve?
Is it tied to specific levels or story beats?

open_questions.context: Plans to add ribbons and larger effect features beyond current pixie-dust.
questions: What limitations of the existing system are you addressing?
How will new effects impact performance on real N64 hardware?
Who will create the art assets for ribbons?

open_questions.context: Engine will be open source after completion, but terms and timing unspecified.
questions: Under what license will the engine be released?
How do you plan to support community forks?
